toggle.label: Ignore eXecutable bit for known extensions

section.toggle: If a file has a known extension (eg '.gif') then ignore the executable bit. This is useful if you have files on a Windows-type filesystem which are being shown as executable programs.
If this is on then directories will always appear before anything else, regardless of the sort type.

section.name: pinboard
section.title: Pinboard
section.label: The pinboard is the desktop background. When the pinboard is turned on, you can drag files and applications onto it to create short-cuts to them. See the manual for information about using the pinboard.
Text style:

section.name: panel
section.title: Panels
section.label: Panels are bars of icons that run along the side of the screen. See the manual for information about using panels.

radio-group.name: style

Applications have just an image, everything else has both an image and text.

section.name: filer
section.title: Filer windows
section.label: Automatically resize filer windows...

radio-group.name: auto_resize
radio-group.radio: You'll have to resize windows manually, using the window manager, the `Resize Window' menu entry or by double-clicking on the window background.
Changing the size of the icons or which details are displayed will resize the window for you.
The filer will resize windows whenever it seems useful (that is, when changing directory or display style).

section.slider: The largest size, as a percentage of the screen size, that the auto-resizer will resize a window to.
section.toggle: If you open a directory and that directory is already displayed in another window, then this option causes the other window to be closed.
When using the `Enter Path...' minibuffer and Tab is pressed, beep if nothing happens (eg, because there are several possibilities and the next letter varies).

toggle.name: beep_multi
toggle.label: Beep if there are several matches

section.toggle: When using the `Enter Path...' minibuffer and Tab is pressed, beep if there is more than one matching file, even though some more letters were added.

section.name: dnd
section.title: Drag and Drop
section.toggle: Some older applications don't support XDND fully and may need to have this option turned on. Use this if dragging files to an application shows a + sign on the pointer but the drop doesn't work.

toggle.name: drag_to_icons
toggle.label: Allow dragging to icons in filer windows

section.toggle: When this is on you can drag a file over a sub-directory or program in a filer window. The item will highlight when you do this and dropping the file will put it into that directory, or load it into the program.
This option, which requires the above option to be turned on too, causes the highlighted directory to 'spring open' after the file is held over it for a short while.
section.slider: This option sets how long, in ms, you must hold a file over a directory before it will spring open. The above option must be turned on for this to have any effect.
section.label: Dragging files with the middle mouse button...

radio-group.name: middle_menu

radio.label: ... shows a menu of possible actions

radio-group.radio: Note that you can still get the menu to appear, by dragging with the left button and holding down the Alt key

section.name: menu
section.title: Menus
section.entry: The program to launch when you choose `Xterm Here' from the menu.
section.notice:
To set a keyboard short-cut for a menu item:
- Open the menu over a filer window, - Move the pointer over the item you want to use, - Press the key you want attached to it.
The key will appear next to the menu item and you can just press that key without opening the menu in future.

section.name: bind
section.title: Mouse bindings

toggle.name: new_button_1
toggle.label: New window on button 1 (RISC OS style)

section.toggle: Clicking with mouse button 1 (usually the left button) opens a directory in a new window with this turned on. Clicking with the button-2 (middle) will reuse the current window.
Use button 2, the middle button (click both buttons at once on two button mice), to pop up the menu. If off, use button 3 (right) instead.
Clicking on an item opens it with this on. Hold down Control to select the item instead. If off, clicking once selects an item; double click to open things.

section.name: type
section.title: Types
section.label: The filer uses a set of rules to work out the correct MIME type for each file, and then chooses a suitable icon for that type.
After editing the files, click the reload button below, or restart the filer.
Use the 'Set Icon...' dialog box to set the icon for each type.
